text: hi everyone Anthony Fantana here the
Internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of the new Shu album
Angel guts red classroom it has not been
a very long time so we've last heard
from long-running art rock experimental
rock indie pop in the experimental pop
weirdness music outfit Shu Shu toward
the end of last year they put out a
full-length LP of Nina Simone covers
titled Nina which I highly recommend for
its raw instrumentation unorthodox
approach and very eerie vibe the band
just dropped their 9th full-length album
right here angel guts red classroom and
on this record they go back to their
roots a little bit once again making
very noisy somewhat tortured post-punk
music doing a bit of a 180 on the
glitchy and 8-bit sounds that have
appeared on their past few albums but
this new record from Shu Shu is more
than just a rehash of the past it is
easily one of the weirdest albums
they've ever put out so far it's
grotesque it's absurd and incredibly
vulgar at times - the instrumentation is
kind of stripped back and a little
unsettling there are a lot of stiff
throbbing drums on this record that for
the most part are electronic
dissonant synthesizers orser's the
vocals here for the most part are really
freakish sometimes they reach really
highs generally I would say this album
is pretty uncomfortable it's difficult
to really snuggle in and get cozy with
this LP even after multiple listens
there are all these rhythms that remind
me of of suicide and the vocals on this
record as well just like with Shu shus
last LP do remind me of Scott Walker a
bit there's not a lot of layers to the
instrumentation on this record but every
piece of sound does serve a very bold
and dark purpose like the very shrill
synth freak-outs on a knife in the Sun
or the pig squealing samples on the
track adult friends or the very noisy
and explosive vocal samples and
manipulations on the track Lawrence
lickers
all the songs here have their own little
thrill to seek and I wouldn't call them
cheap thrills but they are sort of just
thrills all the same there are some
exceptions on here where a melody may
stick out of a track or shoe shoe
actually delivers a song like stupid in
the dark which i think is legitimately
one of their catchy it's the most
well-written tracks they've ever put out
but but a lot of the time what makes
these tracks memorable are moments like
the very fetishize lyrics in the track
black dick or the shrieking vocals on
the tracks Cynthia is a unisex or L NACO
and the result with tracks like these
are songs that I do like a lot and find
very interesting and stimulating but
there is a good handful of tracks on
this record that I do think underwhelm a
little but merely because they're not
much of anything but freakish short and
unstructured tracks that don't really
leave a long lasting impression on me
especially since they seem to cut out
right when the song is at its most
intense even some of the songs on here
that I really like like adult friends I
just wish were a little bit longer and
there are some other songs on here that
are less abrasive slower more ballad
like but are pretty underwhelming as
well because they don't have much in
terms of structure or a climax or a
progression new life immigration or the
track bitter melon overall I think this
new shoo-shoo record is just kind of a
very weird group of vignettes some of
which are very good but a lot of the
song is here do significantly pale in
comparison to others on here still I do
think this record is a vast improvement
over what Shu Shu has done on their past
two original material studio albums I'm
feeling a decent of strong seven on this
thing transition if you've given this
record to listen what did you think of
it did you love it did you hate it why
Anthony fan Tiano Shu Shu forever
